contentrichtext.text: '''''Quester I''''' is the name of a 45-foot [[submarine]] built in 1967 by Jerry Bianco, a shipyard worker in [[Brooklyn, NY]]. Made of salvaged metal, Bianco built the submarine in order to raise the wreck of the passenger ship {{SS|Andrea Doria}}. The submarine was launched unsuccessfully in 1970 when it tipped sideways and became stuck in the muddy banks.<ref>Moynihan, C: [http://www.nytimes.com/2007/11/09/nyregion/09submarine.html?ex=1352350800&en=b2a455f912d2cf2c&ei=5124&partner=permalink&exprod=permalink “In Coney Island Creek, Hulk of a Yellow Submarine Sticks Out,”] The New York Times, November 9, 2007.</ref> The submarine remains in [[Coney Island]] Creek. == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://web.archive.org/web/20110604153445/http://www.forgotten-ny.com/YOU'D%20NEVER%20BELIEVE/yellowsub/yellowsub.html "The Yellow Submarine of Coney Island Creek"], Forgotten New York. Archived from [http://www.forgotten-ny.com/YOU'D%20NEVER%20BELIEVE/yellowsub/yellowsub.html the original] on June 4, 2011. [[Category:Submarines]] [[Category:1970 ships]]
